skills.name: Recognise the notation for right angles

explanations.A: Not quite! Have another think about what an acute angle is.
explanations.B: Not quite! I think you are thinking of an obtuse angle.
explanations.C: Not quite! All angles must be less than 360.
explanations.D: An acute angle is an angle less than 90 degrees.

explanations.A: Not quite, this is an obtuse angle. Think about what an acute angle must be less than!
explanations.B: Not quite, this is a reflex angle. Think about what an acute angle must be less than!
explanations.C: This is an acute angle as 42⁰ is less than 90⁰.
explanations.D: Not quite! This is a right angle. An acute angle cannot be 90 degrees.

explanations.A: Not quite, remember an acute angle is less than 90⁰
explanations.B: This is an obtuse angle as it is greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰
explanations.C: Not quite, remember an reflex angle is greater than 180⁰ - this angle looks to be less than 180⁰
explanations.D: Not quite, remember, a right angle is formed by two perpendicular lines meeting. It is usually marked by a square. Have another look at this angle - it looks to be bigger than a right angle!

explanations.A: Not quite, this is an acute angle. Remember an obtuse angle must be greater than 90⁰
explanations.B: Not quite, this is a reflex angle. Remember an obtuse angle must be less than 180⁰
explanations.C: This is an obtuse angle as it is greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰
explanations.D: Not quite, this is a straight angle. An obtuse angle must be less than 180⁰

explanations.A: Not quite, the square symbol tells us that this is a right angle. Have a think about how many degrees a right angle is.
explanations.B: Not quite, the square symbol tells us that this is a right angle. Have a think about how many degrees a right angle is.
explanations.C: Not quite, the square symbol tells us that this is a right angle. Have a think about how many degrees a right angle is.
explanations.D: The square symbol tells us that this is a right angle, which measures 90⁰

explanations.A: Not quite, the square symbol tells us that these are right angles. Have a think about how many degrees a right angle is.
explanations.B: The square symbol tells us that these are right angles, which measure 90⁰ each
explanations.C: Not quite, the square symbol tells us that these are right angles. Have a think about how many degrees a right angle is.
explanations.D: Not quite, the square symbol tells us that these are right angles. Have a think about how many degrees is in a single right angle.

explanations.A: Not quite, remember an acute angle is less than 90⁰
explanations.B: Not quite, remember an obtuse angle is greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰
explanations.C: 192⁰ is a reflex angle as it is greater than 180⁰
explanations.D: Not quite, remember a right angle is 90⁰

explanations.A: 212⁰ is a reflex angle as it is greater than 180⁰
explanations.B: Not quite, remember an obtuse angle is greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰
explanations.C: Not quite, remember an acute angle is less than 90⁰
explanations.D: Not quite, remember a right angle is 90⁰

explanations.A: Not quite, have another look. Remember, obtuse angles are greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰.
explanations.B: Not quite, have another look. Remember, obtuse angles are greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰.
explanations.C: The two angles at the top of this shape are obtuse. The two at the bottom are acute.
explanations.D: Not quite, have another look. Remember, obtuse angles are greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰.

explanations.A: Not quite, have another look. Remember, obtuse angles are greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰.
explanations.B: The angle at the top left of this shape is obtuse. The two right hand side angles are right angles, and the bottom left is acute.
explanations.C: Not quite, have another look. Remember, obtuse angles are greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰.
explanations.D: Not quite, have another look. Remember, obtuse angles are greater than 90⁰ but less than 180⁰.
